file_content.text: You've got free reign of the outpost. Such as it is.
Hey! You're the people Galen sent, right?
Hey! You're the Jedi Galen sent, right?
Hey! You're that soldier Galen sent, right?
Hey! You're the one Galen sent, right?
Old man's kind of crazy, but he has his moments. I'm Mayor Airen, and this hole-in-the-sand is mine.
Imperial saboteurs were headed for your outpost. They planned to destroy it.
I stopped the Imperials.
You're serious? Huh. Who knew?
What do you know about Galen, anyway? He wouldn't say much.
Tell me about the old man.
Anchorhead's own volunteer politician--does all the work, doesn't take one credit.
How'd you end up mayor? You lose a bet with the Jawas?
What a sorry place.
You don't want to hear the story, trust me.
Galen claims this little outpost is key to uniting the planet. I'd like to agree, but I've got other things to worry about.
Sand People always follow the sandstorms, and there must be a dozen tribes out there. Plus pirates, broken equipment... it's pull out or be slaughtered.
Let me see what I can do. I've handled Sand People and pirates before.
Don't give up yet.
So have we, but not like this.
Why do you and Galen think this outpost is so key?
Is this place truly important?
The outpost builds trade, trade builds community, community builds a self-sufficient planet able to defend itself--not fancy, but it's a start.
Maybe you'd be better off under the Empire. At least you wouldn't get shot by the natives.
You people are pathetic.
Just what I wanted to hear.
Look around, and anything you can do, I'll be grateful. Until things clear up, though, I think you're our last visitor.
We've got a good turnout in the marketplace. Go ahead, spend some credits.
